security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate Python REST API client for the KEGG bioinformatics database. All 256 static findings are false positives: markdown backticks were confused with shell execution, hardcoded URLs are the official KEGG API endpoint, and bioinformatics terminology was misidentified as security threats. The code uses only standard urllib library for outbound HTTP requests to https://rest.kegg.jp with no file system writes, environment access, or external commands.

content.user_title: Query KEGG databases for pathway analysis
content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to KEGG bioinformatics databases for pathway analysis. This skill provides Python helper functions to query pathways, genes, compounds, and drugs via the official KEGG REST API.
actual_capabilities: Query KEGG databases for pathways, genes, compounds, enzymes, diseases, and drugs
Convert identifiers between KEGG and external databases like UniProt, NCBI, and PubChem
Retrieve pathway information, gene sequences, and compound structures in multiple formats
Find gene-pathway associations and drug-drug interactions
Search databases by keywords, chemical formulas, or molecular properties
limitations: Maximum 10 entries per API call (1 entry for image, KGML, and JSON formats)
Academic use only - commercial use requires separate licensing from KEGG
No built-in visualization tools - returns raw data for external processing
Rate limiting not enforced - users must avoid rapid-fire requests

prompt_templates.title: Find gene pathways
prompt_templates.scenario: Get pathways for a specific gene
prompt_templates.prompt: Use kegg_find to find the human TP53 gene, then use kegg_link to find all pathways containing this gene, and kegg_get to retrieve details for each pathway.

prompt_templates.title: Compound search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the KEGG compound database for molecules with chemical formula C6H12O6 using kegg_find. Then use kegg_link to find reactions involving these compounds.

prompt_templates.title: Organism comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: List all pathways for human (hsa), mouse (mmu), and yeast (sce) using kegg_list. Then compare the glycolysis pathway across these organisms using kegg_get.

prompt_templates.title: ID conversion workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert all human gene IDs to UniProt identifiers using kegg_conv. Then retrieve protein sequences for the first 5 converted entries using kegg_get with the aaseq option.

output_examples.input: Find pathways containing the human gene BRCA1
Search for compounds with formula C6H12O6

best_practices: Batch entries using '+' to combine up to 10 IDs per request for efficiency
Cache frequently accessed data locally to reduce API calls
Always check HTTP status codes in responses (400 for errors, 404 for not found)
Use organism-specific pathways (hsa, mmu) rather than reference pathways (map) when possible
anti_patterns: Making rapid sequential requests without delays - KEGG has no documented rate limit but excessive requests may be blocked
Assuming all databases support batch queries - image, KGML, and JSON formats only accept single entries
Using gene names without verification - always confirm IDs with kegg_find before linking
Ignoring academic use restrictions - KEGG API is not licensed for commercial applications

faq.question: Is KEGG API free to use?
faq.answer: KEGG API is free for academic use by academic users. Commercial applications require a separate license from KEGG.

faq.question: What organism codes are supported?
faq.answer: Common codes include hsa (human), mmu (mouse), dme (fruit fly), sce (yeast), and eco (E. coli). Full list in KEGG documentation.

faq.question: Can I get pathway images?
faq.answer: Yes, use kegg_get with the 'image' option. Note this format only accepts one entry at a time.

faq.question: How do I convert gene IDs to other databases?
faq.answer: Use kegg_conv with target database (uniprot, ncbi-geneid, pubchem) and source (e.g., hsa or specific gene ID).

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only makes outbound requests to the official KEGG server and returns results. No data is stored or sent elsewhere.

faq.question: How does this compare to Biopython KEGG module?
faq.answer: This skill provides direct HTTP/REST access with more control. For complex workflows with multiple databases, Biopython may be preferred.
